title.narrative: Training of WCSOs on traditional media use in Mali

description.narrative: - 98% of participants had a better knowledge and understanding of the legal framework for the protection of women's rights in Mali. - 93% of the participants are able to participate with relevance in the TV and radio debates.

Strengthen the capacity of these CSOs to promote and protect women's rights and to engage a conversation through mainstream media on women's issues, including violence against women and political participation, with decisionmakers

he agenda of the workshop was built on two components: (i) a thematic section focused on national laws and policies to promote women's rights, and regional and international instruments for the promotion and protection of the rights of women and girls. The technical section, focused on the experiences of participants in traditional media, and the contribution of the media to the promotion of women's rights. A session on media literacy through a review of the print media and exchanges around Social Media, fake news and digital security
